intro: Amphimas tessmannii, commonly known as the dwarf orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. This species is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Amphimas tessmannii is considered a rare and endangered species.
